questions.question: What is the purpose of AUTO_INCREMENT in MySQL?
Can AUTO_INCREMENT be used with non-integer columns?
Which keyword is used to create a column with auto incrementing value?
What is the default starting value for AUTO_INCREMENT?
Which column type is most suitable for AUTO_INCREMENT?
Which constraint is typically used along with AUTO_INCREMENT?
Can a table have more than one AUTO_INCREMENT column?
Which engine in MySQL supports AUTO_INCREMENT?
What happens if a value is inserted into an AUTO_INCREMENT column?
Which of the following is true about AUTO_INCREMENT?
options: It only works with PRIMARY KEY columns
It can skip values if inserts are rolled back
It stores values in a cache
questions.answer: It can skip values if inserts are rolled back

questions.question: Create a table `students` with an auto-incrementing `id` column.
options: CREATE TABLE students (id INT AUTO_INCREMENT, name VARCHAR(100), PRIMARY KEY(id));
CREATE TABLE students (id INT AUTOINC, name VARCHAR(100));
CREATE TABLE students (id INT, name VARCHAR(100), AUTO_INCREMENT);
CREATE students (id AUTO_INCREMENT INT, name VARCHAR(100));
questions.answer: CREATE TABLE students (id INT AUTO_INCREMENT, name VARCHAR(100), PRIMARY KEY(id));

questions.question: Insert into a table with AUTO_INCREMENT column without specifying the column.
What will be the next value after deleting the last inserted row?
Add AUTO_INCREMENT to existing `id` column in `orders` table.
options: ALTER TABLE orders MODIFY id INT AUTO_INCREMENT;
ALTER TABLE orders ADD AUTO_INCREMENT id;
ALTER TABLE orders SET id = AUTO_INCREMENT;
questions.answer: ALTER TABLE orders MODIFY id INT AUTO_INCREMENT;

questions.question: Change the starting point of AUTO_INCREMENT to 100.
Query to find the last inserted AUTO_INCREMENT value.
Create a table `logs` with `log_id` auto incrementing.
options: CREATE TABLE logs (log_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT, event TEXT, PRIMARY KEY(log_id));
CREATE TABLE logs (log_id TEXT AUTO_INCREMENT, event TEXT);
CREATE TABLE logs (log_id INT, AUTO_INCREMENT, event TEXT);
questions.answer: CREATE TABLE logs (log_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT, event TEXT, PRIMARY KEY(log_id));

questions.question: Insert 3 rows without specifying AUTO_INCREMENT column. What values will it take?
How to prevent inserting a custom value in AUTO_INCREMENT column?
options: Do not mention the column in INSERT statement
questions.answer: Do not mention the column in INSERT statement

questions.question: Reset AUTO_INCREMENT value after deleting all rows.
